Hello Parent_A—thank you for reaching out. We’d be very happy to share more about Nursery_E.

Daily routine (typical day):
- Morning arrival & welcome play, then a short circle time (songs, stories, social routines).
- Learning through play in small groups (language, early numeracy, creative/art, sensory play).
- Outdoor time: we aim for outdoor play every day (weather permitting), usually a longer session mid-morning and/or later in the afternoon.
- Meals: we keep meals and snacks at consistent times and support children’s independence (e.g., self-serving where appropriate) and allergies/dietary needs.
- Nap/rest: after lunch we have a calm rest period; children who nap have a quiet, supervised space, and non-nappers have quiet activities.

Settling-in (first 1–2 weeks):
- We use a gradual, child-led settling plan. Typically this starts with a short visit with a parent/carer present, then short separations, building up to the full session as the child becomes comfortable.
- We assign a key person to your child to provide consistency and a secure attachment, and we keep close communication with you (daily updates early on, plus quick check-ins at drop-off/pick-up).
- If a child is finding separation hard, we adjust the pace rather than forcing a fixed timetable.

Part-time vs full-time:
- We can often accommodate either part-time or full-time attendance, depending on how our remaining schedule fits. If you share what pattern you’re considering (e.g., 2–3 set days, mornings only, alternating weeks), I can tell you what’s most feasible.

If Nursery_E is one of your leading options, we’d love to be considered—feel free to apply when you’re ready, and I can also answer anything specific about your child’s needs (sleep, allergies, temperament, language, etc.) to ensure a smooth start.
